page.title: 18The New River
page.content:
The New River was 'started' in 1609 by Sir Hugh Myddleton. The river was not built by machinery but by hand and it was lined with clay. It took 4 years to complete and the idea was to bring a water supply to the City of London.
Thames Water Authority maintain the banks of the river. Chemicals have been used in the past and these have unfortunately destroyed some of the fish. Tractors are too large to work on the banks so the grass is trimmed by hand. The cut grass floats downstream to Turnford where it is stopped by lorries and taken away.
The New River is a well-known feature in this area and is still supplying water to London
